faq.question: What is the difference between Tailwind v3 and v4 config?
faq.answer: Tailwind v4 uses the new @theme directive for inline CSS configuration instead of the traditional tailwind.config.js file. This allows defining CSS variables and mapping them directly in CSS without JavaScript configuration.

faq.question: How does dark mode work with Tailwind v4?
faq.answer: Dark mode uses CSS prefers-color-scheme to automatically detect system preferences. The theme-provider component toggles a class on the HTML element, and CSS variables switch between light and dark values.

faq.question: Can I use this with existing shadcn/ui projects?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill is designed specifically for shadcn/ui. It follows the shadcn/ui pattern of using CSS variables for all colors, making the setup compatible with their component library.

faq.question: What errors does this skill prevent?
faq.answer: The skill prevents 8 documented errors including tw-animate-css loading failures, @theme inline conflicts, @apply breaking on custom properties, and v3 migration issues.

faq.question: Does this skill install packages automatically?
faq.answer: No, the skill provides guidance on the correct commands and order but requires Claude to execute terminal commands to install packages and create files.

faq.question: Can I use this with frameworks other than React?
faq.answer: The core Tailwind v4 setup works with any framework. The shadcn/ui-specific parts require React, but the CSS variable and @theme patterns are framework-agnostic.
